p: Jujube fruit from the family Rhamnaceae is one of the valuable, yet not well-recognized medicinal foods mostly grown in Iran and China ( Shahrajabian et al., 2019). It is a popular plant as a traditional remedy for different types of coughs. In TPM, it is mostly considered as a modulator of the quality of humor, mainly by preventing the negative effect of excess heat. It is also described as having soothing effects on pulmonary inflammations and shortness of breath ( Aghili Khorasani, 1771). In addition to its high nutritive value, jujube is a rich source of bioactive secondary metabolites such as polyphenols, polysaccharides, and terpenoids ( Gao et al., 2013).
